class Child(Model):

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

phone¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

profile_pic¶

Just like the FileDescriptor, but for ImageFields. The only difference is assigning the width/height to the width_field/height_field, if appropriate.

reviewandcomment_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

save(*args, **kwargs)¶

Save the current instance. Override this in a subclass if you want to control the saving process.

The ‘force_insert’ and ‘force_update’ parameters can be used to insist that the “save” must be an SQL insert or update (or equivalent for non-SQL backends), respectively. Normally, they should not be set.

user¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

home.urls.py¶

This program is for mapping the views and URLs

home.urls.path(route, view, kwargs=None, name=None, *, Pattern=<class 'django.urls.resolvers.RoutePattern'>)¶

home.views.py¶

home.views.delete_profile(request)¶

This will redirect the url to the delete profile page

Parameters:request (HttpResponse) – Takes the request to show delete_profile.html
home.views.edit_profile_student(request)¶

This will redirect the url to update the profile if the user is student where they can update their necessary informations which will be displayed on profile page after saving them

Parameters:request (HttpResponse) – Takes the request to show edit_profile_tutor.html
home.views.edit_profile_tutor(request)¶

This will redirect the url to update the profile if the user is tutor where they can update their necessary informations which will be displayed on profile page after saving them

Parameters:request (HttpResponse) – Takes the request to show edit_profile_tutor.html
home.views.landing(request)¶

This will redirect the url to the landing page

Parameters:request (HttpResponse) – Takes the request to show home.html
home.views.profile(request)¶

This will redirect the url to the profile page

Parameters:request (HttpResponse) – Takes the request to show profile.html
home.views.signin(request)¶

This will redirect the url to the signin

Parameters:request (HttpResponse) – Takes the request to show signin.html
home.views.signout(request)¶

This will logout the user & redirect to the landing page

Parameters:request (HttpResponse) – Takes the request to show landing.html
home.views.signup(request)¶

This will redirect the url to the signup

Parameters:request (HttpResponse) – Takes the request to show signup.html
